facts.text: The Queen of Cyprus, Catherine Cornaro, sells her kingdom to Venice.
Storm floods ravage Gorinchem, Dordrecht & Woudrichem, Netherlands
Battle of Ivry: French King Henri IV beats Catholic League during French Wars of Religion
England grants patent for Providence Plantations (now Rhode Island)
Thirty Years' War: Bavaria, Cologne, France and Sweden sign the Truce of Ulm.
Johan van Galen beats English fleet at Livorno
Scotland dismisses William III & Mary Stuart as king & queen
On board HMS Monarch (his own flagship), British Admiral John Byng is executed by firing squad for neglecting his duty "Pour encourager les autres".
Eli Whitney patents the cotton gin machine revolutionizing cotton industry in the southern US states
Luigi Chiaramonti crowned Pope Pius VII
Congress authorizes war bonds to finance War of 1812
African Methodist Episcopal Zion Church founded (NY)
General Congress of South American States assembles at Panama
